page.title: 01STANWICK, FORCETT & CARLTON
page.content: At the start of this century, the hamlets of{Stanwick, Carlton}and part of{Forcett}formed part of the extensive estates of the {Duke of {Northumberland.}Ten years after the death of{Eleanor, the Dowager Duchess, the farms, lands and houses were sold at an{auction} held in {Darlington} on {6th. Oct. 1921}and were bought largely by the former tenants.These properties have, over the years, passed down to their descendants. {Stanwick Hall} was demolished shortly after the sale and only some ancillary buildings such as the {stables and laundry}still remain today; these having been {converted to {housing.} Only a few new houses have been built in recent years in Stanwick most of the building work has taken place in Carlton and Forcett. The{area {thus remains} much as it was, {wholly {rural.}
